intro: Cyrtandra × plurifolia, commonly known as the hybrid blue ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptic in shape and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra × plurifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streamside areas.
